alert.note: Alert for Caswell; Rockingham; Stokes; Surry; Wilkes; Yadkin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Surry, Stokes, Wilkes, Rockingham, Caswell and Yadkin Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 243 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking numerous strong thunderstorms extending along a line from Pilot Mountain to Danbury, to Mayodan, to Yanceyville. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eden... Reidsville... Mount Airy... North Wilkesboro... Elkin... Wilkesboro... and Fairview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
